name: Maydrit Hotel

reviews.title: Ruined - open the pool in June - it's hot !
reviews.text: It's 31 degrees outside, 5th June, I chose this hotel because I wanted to relax by the pool and it's STILL closed. Luis at the reception was the most miserable person I have ever met. I could have had a city centre hotel with an OPEN roof-top pool for more or less the same price.
Rooms and decor is nice however.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotrl close to airport

reviews.text: Big, modern and comfortable rooms. Just spent 1 night at the hotel but it was enough to enjoy a very complete breakfast with quality. There is an outdoor swimingpool but was still closed. The airport is just 2km from the hotel.
reviews.title: Plenty of space, perfect for families

reviews.text: We travelled with our two children (5 & 1) and shared a huge bedroom (which seems to be the standard size) with a king-size bed, cot and extra bed, and still the kids had plenty of space to move and play. Decoration was very stylish and relaxing, with multiple-switch lights and a big LG teli. Bathroom shares the room with a shower plate and toilet area with traslucent glass-doors.
reviews.title: If you need to stay by the airport this is the place

reviews.text: Swimming-pool is outside, so we couldn't enjoy it, as it wasn't open yet.
reviews.title: Delightful Stay

reviews.text: I chose the hotel based on reviews, but it did not meet expectations. The hotel itself is great, but the devil is in the details...
reviews.title: so-so

reviews.text: 1. The paid wi-fi does not work for Apple products!! The two public PCs in the lobby are slow and badly taken care of.
reviews.title: friendly staff

reviews.text: 2. There is a free shuttle to and from airport and fair, but when I made a reservation to get picked up from the fair, the shuttle was overbooked with a group - and I was left standing by the curb, having to wait a second round of 30 minutes in the cold. Not like the hotel called me to offer a solution. Only after 6x calling, the reception picked up and told me the next one would arrive within 5 minutes, which they had to know was not true.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. There is no direct metro connection to the airport or the fair, so you depend on the hotel shuttle (that only runs to the fair in the mornings and evenings every 30 minutes) and taxis, the latter of which get pricey fast because of the hotel's location tucked away in a weirdly inaccessible residential area.
reviews.title: Sublime service

reviews.text: 4. I don't know if this is true for all rooms, but my bed was on wheels of which the fixtures didn't hold. Tricky enough as a single person, imaginably impossible for couples...
reviews.title: For a stop-over in Madrid, this is the hotel to stay!

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect! I called the hotel from the airport and the shuttle was here is less than 10 minutes.Since we landed at 845am the room was not available, but the hotel was happy to store luggage. Metro stop is 2 blocks from the hotel and about20-30 min ride, costing 3 euro to station Opera (close to puerta de sol and plaza mayor) Did not get a chance to eat in their restaurant as it serves dinner from 8p to 1030p but menu seemed reasonable for price fix euro pp. Room was wonderful, conmfortable beds,modern bathroom. would highly recommend.
reviews.title: great hotel highly recommend

reviews.text: b
reviews.title: Good hotel, close to airport

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my last night in Madrid as I had an early morning flight the next day. The room is clean and VERY spacious and well-appointed. The check in and check out process was smooth. The complimentary shuttle service to the airport was on time and took a little over 5 minutes to get to terminal 2.
reviews.title: Decent
Great location and excellent rooms.
reviews.text: The only disappointment was the lack of wifi which was included in the room price but which they said was not working. They had made 2 laptops available for guests, however couldn't use it much as there were either people on it, or people waiting for it when I finally did get a laptop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was pretty basic but it was clean, it's close to the airport and it's right down the road from a subway station. Overall it's a good deal. I honestly did not care for the city of Madrid but I'd recommend this hotel if you are going to stay in Madrid. Only bad thing is that there's no free WiFi which I don't like but ended up that we really did have it included in the package we got from Price Line but we didn't know till the last day we were there so we had to find a Starbucks to check our Facebooks and stuff.
reviews.title: good quality

reviews.text: I had come from a 4 star hotel at Budapest Airport but Maydrit felt like a 5 star plus compared to a 1 star for Budapest !
reviews.title: Great hotel near Madrid Airport with free schedule

reviews.text: This is a real classy hotels. Excellent people at reception . Great beds and pillows and plenty of space .
reviews.title: Best airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Call hotel in advance to get free schedule otherwise call on arrival with a 15 minutes wait .
reviews.title: Super hotel for stopover

reviews.text: My only issue is the chair at the desk in the room. It broke and I ended up on the floor ! I later understood that this issue happened in previous rooms so they must replace the type of chair to sit on in the room( I advised them) . Definitely I will return however . It was great value for a Friday night . W
reviews.title: good hotel for airport and convention centre
Wow! What a bathroom!
reviews.text: Some 7kms from the airport - and none too easy to find, this remains the most un-airport hotel I've ever seen. It would do justice in the city. Swimming pool, large room, exceptional bathroom, internet, leafy outlook. The TV offerings are poor if English is your language. Beds are very comfortable with great duvets and pillows.

description: Located strategically between Barajas airport and Ifema fairgrounds is one of the last hotel built by Hotels Santos.The Hotel Maydrit opened in the summer of 2008 which makes it a modern and functional hotel. The Hotel is situated in one of the busiest commercial areas in the northeast of Madrid, very close to Madrid Barajas Airport and the IFEMA fairgrounds. This hotel has all the best in comfort to ensure our clients enjoy a pleasant and unforgettable stay.Our strategic location next to Barajas airport and its proximity to Ifema.
